Creating and Managing Projects

07 Jun 2022 - 1 minute to read
The first step in the Altilia Intelligent Automation™ platform is the creation of a Project, that is an Artifact on which it’s then possible to work using the Modules provided by the platform.
You can recognize that you are in the Projects view by the indication provided in the upper left corner of the screen:

Before you Start

Make sure you are logged into the platform, otherwise read chapter Account Setup with Altilia Intelligent Automation™first.

Create Project

    1. In the Homepage of the Altilia Intelligent Automation™, create a new Project by clicking on “+ New Project”
    1. Type name and description (optional) of your project and then click on “Create” on the central panel that appears to you:
    1. At the same time a pop-up message is displayed on the screen asking you if you want immediately to be redirected to the details of the newly created project described in the paragraph Project General Overview. In this case click on “Yes” otherwise you can postpone it to a later time (by clicking “No”).
    1. Your Project is now saved. To access the settings page please follow the paragraph Access into Projects.

Project Information

Your Projects are available in the Home page, you can use the sorting and searching functionality to find it as described in the paragraph Sorting and Search Projects:
    1. Inside a Project panel, several information regarding the created Project are shown. You can also find the same information in the drawer panel as described in the paragraph Project Drawer Information. From the top to the bottom at the left side of the panel you can find:
    • Project Name: also clickable to edit it as described in Edit Project,
    • Author: username of the owner,
    • Artifacts: the Artifacts that have been created on the Project, for each one its number is shown,
    • Last Update: date time of the last changes.
    1. Also within the Project panel, you can also find other two features at the upper right corner side, read also more about them in the paragraph Project Card Settings:
    • Quick button: interchangeable button with other functions that you can set,
    • Three dots: to access, delete and archive the Project.
    1. Lastly, at the bottom right corner side the Status of the Project is reported, find out more by reading Project Status.

Project Card Settings

    1. In the Home page, set the quick button of your Projects panel so that the most frequently used icon appears to you by clicking the three dots icon in the upper right corner of each Project panel.
    1. Pin the desidered icon in order to see it next to the left of the three dots icon. By default it’s set to “Go to Project”, read more about it on the paragraph Access into Projects.
    1. Click the pin icon to the right of “Archive” to set it as a quick button for each Project, read more about it on the paragraph Archive and Unarchive Projects.
    1. Click the pin icon to the right of “Delete” to set it as a quick button for each Project, read more about it on the paragraph Delete Projects.

Edit Project

    1. In the Home Page, edit your already created Project of interest by clicking on the name at the top left of its panel:
    1. The drawer panel opens at the right of the screen enabling you to change name and description of the Project:
    1. Overwrite them and click anywhere on the screen outside the drawer panel to apply the changes. A pop-up message is displayed as confirmation:

Project Drawer Functionality

From the following drawer it’s also possible to use some features designed to speed up the navigation in the platform.
    1. Access in a Project by clicking on the “Details” button on the bottom side of the drawer panel:
    1. Archive a Project by clicking on the “Archive” button on the bottom side of the drawer panel.
    1. Remove a Project by clicking on the “Delete” button on the bottom side of the drawer panel.

Project Drawer Information

Inside the drawer panel on the right of the screen, the same information shown in each Project panel created is also displayed:
  • Author: username of the owner,
  • Last Update: date time of the last changes,
  • Artifacts: the Artifacts that have been created on the Project, for each one its number is shown.
    •

    Access into Projects

      1. In the Home page, access your Project already created by clicking on the three dots icon in the upper right corner of desidered Project panel and then on “Go to Project”:
      1. The page you are redirected to is the “General” page which is described in paragraph Project General Overview.
    It’s also possible to access a Project by quick button as described in paragraphs Project Card Settings or from the drawer panel as shown in Project Drawer Functionality.

    Project General Overview

    In the Altilia Intelligent Automation™ app, see the details of your Project by clicking on its name if you are in the Home Page, otherwise by clicking on “General” on the left navigation bar. The General Overview opens.
    Below is the information of the selected Project. Under the heading “Basic Info” at the left side of current view you can find:
  • Created - the creation date;
  • Last update - the date of the last change made;
  • Description- the description you entered at the time of creation. If you want to change it, read the Edit Project chapter;
  • Author - the username of the project creator;
  • Status - the condition state.
    •
    Under the heading “Artifacts” at the right side of current view you can see the number and the names of each of following services:
  • Knowledge Bases
  • Datasets
  • Connectors

    • Go back to the Home Page

    After entering a Project, from any Module it’s possible to return in the Home Page by clicking to the folder icon on the top center of the screen.

    Archive and Unarchive Projects

  • Archive
    It gives the ability to archive projects without deleting them in case you are unsure of their usability. In the Home Page, archive your Project already created by clicking on the three dots icon in the upper right corner of desidered Project panel and then on “Archive”:
  • Unarchive
    The number of archived Projects are displayed at the top left of the current view as described in the paragraph Project Status.
      1. To unarchive a Project click on “Archived” at top left of the screen
      1. From here you can activate again the desired Project by clicking on the unarchive icon at top right of its panel.

    Delete Projects

    Note that deleted Project will no longer be recoverable. If you are unsure about deleting it, please archive it as described in the Archive and Unarchive Projects chapter.
      1. In the Home Page, delete your Project already created by clicking on the three dots icon in the upper right corner of desidered Project panel and then on “Delete”
      1. A pop-up message appears on the screen requesting double confirmation. Click on “Yes” if you are sure to delete the selected Knowledge Base, otherwise click on “No”.

    Project Status

      1. In the Home Page at the top left of the current view, a filter is available to display active and archived Projects. In parentheses is the count of Projects that are in that particular state. By default, the Projects with “Active” status are shown.
      1. Show only the archived Project by clicking on “Archived”.
      1. Show all created Projects by clicking on “All”.

    Sorting and Search Projects

    In the Home Page, sorting and search tools are available.
      1. By default, the “Last Modified” sorting is used but you can select also by “Name” or “Author”
      1. Furthermore, if you want to search directly for the name of a Project then you can do it using the search tool..
